block.p: Russia's summer lull was shattered by a terrorist bomb that exploded on Tuesday in a busy pedestrian tunnel beneath Pushkin Square, killing eight and wounding nearly 100. Within hours, Mayor Yuri M. Luzhkov claimed responsibility lay ''100 percent'' with Chechnya, the breakaway republic where rebel leaders had been vowing to strike Russian cities. Russian President Vladimir V. Putin, however, said it would be premature to blame the Chechens, and though police quickly rounded up suspects, none was immediately connected to the bombing.
